sources.title: A Walk in the Sun (1945) WWII platoon march: Outsmart patrols, seize the crossroads
sources.description:
THEY FOUGHT BEST WHEN IT WAS HOPELESS! 
During World War II, a platoon of American soldiers trudge through the Italian countryside in search of a bridge they have been ordered to blow up, slipping past patrols, encountering danger and destruction along the way, and moving to quietly disable the bridge.

Colorized version: https://youtu.be/WXaqSdSrPf0

Director: Lewis Milestone
Writers: Harry Brown, Robert Rossen
Stars: Dana Andrews, Richard Conte, George Tyne, John Ireland, Lloyd Bridges, Sterling Holloway 

Genres: War, Drama, Tragedy, 
Release date: December 25, 1945 
Filming location: California


https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=UUMOycDFnpMeWzaITQSD1dWsOA

@CultCinemaClassics

metadata.Plot: In the 1943 invasion of Italy, one American platoon lands, digs in, then makes its way inland to blow up a bridge next to a fortified farmhouse, as tension and casualties mount. Unusually realistic picture of war as long quiet stretches of talk, punctuated by sharp, random bursts of violent action whose relevance to the big picture is often unknown to the soldiers.
metadata.Actors: Dana Andrews, Richard Conte, George Tyne
metadata.Awards: Nominated for 1 BAFTA Award2 wins & 1 nomination total
